00034 
00035 #include "contiki.h"
00036 #ifdef __IAR_SYSTEMS_ICC__
00037 #include <msp430.h>
00038 #else
00039 #include <io.h>
00040 #include <signal.h>
00041 #endif
00042 
00043 #include "sys/energest.h"
00044 #include "sys/clock.h"
00045 #include "sys/etimer.h"
00046 #include "rtimer-arch.h"
00047 #include "watchdog.h"
00048 
00049 #define INTERVAL (RTIMER_ARCH_SECOND / CLOCK_SECOND)
00050 
00051 #define MAX_TICKS (~((clock_time_t)0) / 2)
00052 
00053 static volatile unsigned long seconds;
00054 
00055 static volatile clock_time_t count = 0;
00056 /* last_tar is used for calculating clock_fine */
00057 static volatile uint16_t last_tar = 0;
00058 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00059 #ifdef __IAR_SYSTEMS_ICC__
00060 #pragma vector=TIMERA1_VECTOR
00061 __interrupt void
00062 #else
00063 interrupt(TIMERA1_VECTOR)
00064 #endif
00065 timera1 (void) {
00066   ENERGEST_ON(ENERGEST_TYPE_IRQ);
00067 
00068   watchdog_start();
00069 
00070   if(TAIV == 2) {
00071 
00072     /* HW timer bug fix: Interrupt handler called before TR==CCR.
00073      * Occurrs when timer state is toggled between STOP and CONT. */
00074     while(TACTL & MC1 && TACCR1 - TAR == 1);
00075 
00076     /* Make sure interrupt time is future */
00077     do {
00078       TACCR1 += INTERVAL;
00079       ++count;
00080 
00081       /* Make sure the CLOCK_CONF_SECOND is a power of two, to ensure
00082          that the modulo operation below becomes a logical and and not
00083          an expensive divide. Algorithm from Wikipedia:
00084          http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Power_of_two */
00085 #if (CLOCK_CONF_SECOND & (CLOCK_CONF_SECOND - 1)) != 0
00086 #error CLOCK_CONF_SECOND must be a power of two (i.e., 1, 2, 4, 8, 16, 32, 64, ...).
00087 #error Change CLOCK_CONF_SECOND in contiki-conf.h.
00088 #endif
00089       if(count % CLOCK_CONF_SECOND == 0) {
00090         ++seconds;
00091         energest_flush();
00092       }
00093     } while((TACCR1 - TAR) > INTERVAL);
00094 
00095     last_tar = TAR;
00096 
00097     if(etimer_pending() &&
00098        (etimer_next_expiration_time() - count - 1) > MAX_TICKS) {
00099       etimer_request_poll();
00100       LPM4_EXIT;
00101     }
00102 
00103   }
00104   /*  if(process_nevents() >= 0) {
00105     LPM4_EXIT;
00106     }*/
00107 
00108   watchdog_stop();
00109   
00110   ENERGEST_OFF(ENERGEST_TYPE_IRQ);
00111 }
00112 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00113 clock_time_t
00114 clock_time(void)
00115 {
00116   clock_time_t t1, t2;
00117   do {
00118     t1 = count;
00119     t2 = count;
00120   } while(t1 != t2);
00121   return t1;
00122 }
00123 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00124 void
00125 clock_set(clock_time_t clock, clock_time_t fclock)
00126 {
00127   TAR = fclock;
00128   TACCR1 = fclock + INTERVAL;
00129   count = clock;
00130 }
00131 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00132 int
00133 clock_fine_max(void)
00134 {
00135   return INTERVAL;
00136 }
00137 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00138 unsigned short
00139 clock_fine(void)
00140 {
00141   unsigned short t;
00142   /* Assign last_tar to local varible that can not be changed by interrupt */
00143   t = last_tar;
00144   /* perform calc based on t, TAR will not be changed during interrupt */
00145   return (unsigned short) (TAR - t);
00146 }
00147 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00148 void
00149 clock_init(void)
00150 {
00151   dint();
00152 
00153   /* Select SMCLK (2.4576MHz), clear TAR */
00154   /* TACTL = TASSEL1 | TACLR | ID_3; */
00155   
00156   /* Select ACLK 32768Hz clock, divide by 2 */
00157   /*  TACTL = TASSEL0 | TACLR | ID_1;*/
00158 
00159   /* Select ACLK 32768Hz clock */
00160   TACTL = TASSEL0 | TACLR;
00161 
00162   /* Initialize ccr1 to create the X ms interval. */
00163   /* CCR1 interrupt enabled, interrupt occurs when timer equals CCR1. */
00164   TACCTL1 = CCIE;
00165 
00166   /* Interrupt after X ms. */
00167   TACCR1 = INTERVAL;
00168 
00169   /* Start Timer_A in continuous mode. */
00170   TACTL |= MC1;
00171 
00172   count = 0;
00173 
00174   /* Enable interrupts. */
00175   eint();
00176 
00177 }
00178 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00179 /**
00180  * Delay the CPU for a multiple of 2.83 us.
00181  */
00182 void
00183 clock_delay(unsigned int i)
00184 {
00185   asm("add #-1, r15");
00186   asm("jnz $-2");
00187   /*
00188    * This means that delay(i) will delay the CPU for CONST + 3x
00189    * cycles. On a 2.4756 CPU, this means that each i adds 1.22us of
00190    * delay.
00191    *
00192    * do {
00193    *   --i;
00194    * } while(i > 0);
00195    */
00196 }
00197 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00198 /**
00199  * Wait for a multiple of 10 ms.
00200  *
00201  */
00202 void
00203 clock_wait(int i)
00204 {
00205   clock_time_t start;
00206 
00207   start = clock_time();
00208   while(clock_time() - start < (clock_time_t)i);
00209 }
00210 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00211 void
00212 clock_set_seconds(unsigned long sec)
00213 {
00214 
00215 }
00216 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00217 unsigned long
00218 clock_seconds(void)
00219 {
00220   unsigned long t1, t2;
00221   do {
00222     t1 = seconds;
00223     t2 = seconds;
00224   } while(t1 != t2);
00225   return t1;
00226 }
00227 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00228 rtimer_clock_t
00229 clock_counter(void)
00230 {
00231   return TAR;
00232 }
